questions.question: What is the primary means of formation pressure control?

options.E: Mud hydrostatic pressure plus annular pressure loss

questions.explanation: Mud hydrostatic pressure is ALWAYS the primary control. BOPs are secondary—you don't want to use them unless primary fails.

questions.question: What is the secondary means of formation pressure control?
questions.explanation: BOPs are secondary control—the backup when mud column can't contain formation pressure.

questions.question: What is the primary prevention method for kicks?

options.B: Closing well with Blow Out Preventers
options.C: Monitoring pit volume and flow rate
options.D: Using mud hydrostatic to balance formation pressure

questions.explanation: PREVENTION comes from maintaining proper mud weight. Monitoring detects kicks; BOPs respond to kicks. Prevention stops kicks from happening.

questions.question: Minimum barriers normally required during drilling operations?
questions.explanation: Two barrier philosophy: Primary (mud hydrostatic) + Secondary (BOP/casing/cement). Never operate with single barrier.
